test.name: Execute Command And Verify Output

kw.name: Execute Command
kw.doc: Executes ``command`` on the remote machine and returns its outputs.

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

test.doc: Execute Command can be used to run commands on the remote machine. The keyword returns the standard output by default.

test.name: Start Server

kw.name: Switch Connection
kw.doc: Switches the active connection by index or alias.

kw.name: Execute Command
kw.doc: Executes ``command`` on the remote machine and returns its outputs.

kw.name: Write
kw.doc: Writes the given ``text`` on the remote machine and appends a newline.

kw.name: Read Until
kw.doc: Consumes and returns the server output until ``expected`` is encountered.
kw.msg: No match found for '...' in 3 seconds Output: -bash: ./run_server: No such file or directory root@b61effe776c4:/git# .

test.status: No match found for '...' in 3 seconds Output: -bash: ./run_server: No such file or directory root@b61effe776c4:/git# .

kw.name: Close All Connections

suite.doc: This example demonstrates executing commands on a remote machine and getting their output and the return code. http://robotframework.org/SSHLibrary/SSHLibrary.html#Read Notice how connections are handled as part of the suite setup and teardown. This saves some time when executing several test cases.
